results.title: Malcolm [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Cascade Films, Nadia Tass and David Parker
results.brief_description: Malcolm, a simple genius played by Colin Friels, loses his job at a Melbourne tram depot after building his own one-man tram and taking to the streets. With funds dwindling, Malcolm is forced to take in a lodger, a small time criminal who moves in with girlfriend, Judith. Frank soon realizes that Malcolm’s mechanical wizardry can help his career - the result - a series of oddball but unsuccessful robberies that culminates in the heist of the decade that stretches Malcolm’s devises to the full. “Malcolm” was critically acclaimed world wide and received eight AFI Awards including best director and best film.

results.title: Malbangka country (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Curtis Levy
results.brief_description: Gustav Malbangka and his family have set up their own community at Gilbert Springs, in the heart of Malbangka country. Gustav talks about his early life, his reasons for leaving Hermannsburg (a Lutheran Mission in Central Australia) and his plans for the future. Shows daily life at Gilbert Springs and a trip to Areyonga. Photography by Geoff Burton. Narrated by Gus Williams.

results.title: Malayan University
results.creator_credit: Malayan Film Unit and Osman Shamsudin
results.brief_description: The University of Malaya is young, but its growing reputation has already fully justified its foundation, in 1949, with full university status. It has faculties of Arts, Science and Medicine. The film shows the work being done in these and the wide range of cultural activities available to its students as well as their formal studies.

results.title: Malayan seashore
results.creator_credit: Malayan Film Unit and Tom Hodge
results.brief_description: The rich variety of delicate living organisms which abounds on the Malayan seashore, on sandy beaches, coral reefs and in mangrove swamps. The fascination lies in the various forms of sea life left by the receding tide and the strange creatures found above as well as below the surface.

results.title: Malaya: land of tin and rubber
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: A survey of life in rain forests of the Malay Peninsula, showing production of latex on a rubber plantation, mining and processing of tin ore, and activities on the island of Singapore. Discusses Malaya’s position in the area of world trade and reviews contributions of Chinese, Malayas, Indians, and Europeans to present-day culture.

results.title: Malaya speaks
results.brief_description: An account of the varied services provided by Radio Malaya, which broadcasts programs of entertainment, information, and education in several languages to a listening public of many different races, age-groups and tastes. Besides news, general entertainment and school programs, Radio Malaya broadcasts programs designed to teach people to read, and many programs of special interest to rural communities.

results.title: Malaya posting
results.brief_description: Australian overseas army personnel in Malaya. The contrasts of old and new in this multi-racial Asian country; surrender barracks and the facilities for servicemen’s families; training in jungle warfare, tropical first aid; transport in the jungle; sports and places to visit in leisure time. Australia’s servicemen as ambassadors.

results.title: Malawi: two young men
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Dimension Films and Max Reid
results.brief_description: After completing school, two friends are faced with the problem of finding a place in Malawian society. They are shown in an unsuccessful attempt to become middlemen, buying and smoking fish, then selling them at an inland market. Failing, they go to a city where they spend days seeking work. Unemployment, high cost of living and unfriendly people sends one of the two back to his village.
